Name: man
Description: Format and display the on-line manual pages

Arguments.Name: C
Arguments.Description: Specify the configuration file to use

Arguments.Name: M
Arguments.Description: Specify the list of directories to search (colon separated)

Arguments.Name: P
Arguments.Description: Specify the pager program

Arguments.Name: B
Arguments.Description: Specify which browser to use for HTML files

Arguments.Name: H
Arguments.Description: Specify a command that renders HTML files as text

Arguments.Name: S
Arguments.Description: Specify a colon-separated list of manual sections to search

Arguments.Name: a
Arguments.Description: Open every matching page instead of just the first

Arguments.Name: c
Arguments.Description: Reformat the source page, even when an up-to-date cat-page exists

Arguments.Name: d
Arguments.Description: Don't actually display the pages (dry run)

Arguments.Name: D
Arguments.Description: Both display and print debugging info

Arguments.Name: f
Arguments.Description: Equivalent to `whatis`

Arguments.Name: -F
Arguments.Description: Format only, do not display

Arguments.Name: h
Arguments.Description: Print a help message and exit

Arguments.Name: k
Arguments.Description: Equivalent to apropos

Arguments.Name: K
Arguments.Description: Search for a given string in all pages

Arguments.Name: m
Arguments.Description: Specify an alternate set of pages to search based on the system name given

Arguments.Name: p
Arguments.Description: Specify the sequence of preprocessors to run before nroff or troff

Arguments.Name: t
Arguments.Description: Use `/usr/bin/groff -Tps -mandoc -c` to format the page

Arguments.Name: -w
Arguments.Description: Print the location of files that would be displayed

Arguments.Name: W
Arguments.Description: Print file locations, one per line
Manual page to show
